item.title: Telecom and Network Domain Names For Sale
item.description:
By: John Shepler A strong domain name is crucial for any online business. The best names reflect your business, are easy to remember for offline use, and are pronounceable. Owning your own domain provides a much stronger online identity compared to generic alternatives. This ownership gives you full control over your website, email, and branding. I’ve worked in business telecom for almost 15 years and acquired many domain names related to that industry...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/telecom-and-network-domain-names-for-sale/

item.title: Dude, Where's My Site?
item.description:
Ever feel like the internet is taking a break, but you’re not sure if it’s just you? Sometimes, websites refuse to load, leaving you wondering if the problem is on your end. A new tool called DownForEveryoneOrJustMe.com provides a simple solution. Just enter the website address, and it will tell you if the site is truly down or if it’s just your connection. Created by a Twitter engineer, DownForEveryoneOrJustMe.com addresses the common question of whether a website is offline or if it’s a personal issue...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/dude-wheres-my-site/

item.title: Today is the day for the landrush of .global, .website, and .press domain names
item.description:
Starting August 27th, Singapore time, several top-level domain names will be up for grabs in a “landrush” phase, according to online brand specialist IP Mirror. The “sunrise” phase, reserved for trademark holders to register their brands, precedes this period. During the landrush phase, anyone can secure remaining domain names at a premium price. IP Mirror highlights “.global” as a particularly appealing option, signifying a broad international reach. This domain’s landrush phase lasts from August 27th to September 4th...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/today-is-the-day-for-the-landrush-of-global-website-and-press-domain-names/

item.title: You can now get .cn domain names from GoDaddy
item.description:
GoDaddy, a company that provides technology specifically to small businesses, now offers a total of 421 domain name extensions. This increase is due to the addition of the “.cn” domain, China’s country code. This expansion targets the growing number of Chinese residents seeking to establish an online presence. China boasts over 1.6 billion internet users, with over 600 million residing within the country itself. While China has registered over 16 million “...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/you-can-now-get-cn-domain-names-from-godaddy/

item.title: The domain name "Dot World" is now in the sunrise period for Chinese, Japanese, and Korean languages
item.description:
Stable Tone’s DotWorld_IDN Registry has started the sunrise period for its Chinese, Japanese, and Korean top-level domain (TLD). This period, ending on November 10, 2015, allows trademark holders with prior rights to register DotWorld_IDN domain names before the public launch. Starting November 17, 2015, anyone can register these domains on a first-come, first-served basis. The two-character domain extension, 世界, translates to “world” in all three languages (pronounced “shijie” in Chinese, “seikai” in Japanese, and “segye” in Korean)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-domain-name-dot-world-is-now-in-the-sunrise-period-for-chinese-japanese-and-korean-languages/

item.title: GoDaddy is dedicated to creating impressive and impactful business identities for small businesses
item.description:
GoDaddy: Expanding Beyond Domains to Empower Small Businesses While GoDaddy is known for domain names, it has evolved into much more. CEO Blake Irving emphasizes the company’s focus on supporting small businesses, a demographic often overlooked despite representing a significant portion of most economies. Irving highlights that small businesses, even those with a single employee, present a vast untapped market. Traditional solutions often cater to either large enterprises or individual consumers, leaving small businesses underserved...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/godaddy-is-dedicated-to-creating-impressive-and-impactful-business-identities-for-small-businesses/

item.title: Looking for innovative management reporter solutions
item.description:
While I vaguely remember the show “In Search Of,” I’m currently focused on finding solutions to Management Reporter challenges rather than Bigfoot or the Bermuda Triangle. I’m seeking creative solutions, even if they’re unconventional, for two specific Management Reporter issues: Implementing Management Reporter in environments without a domain or Active Directory. Managing high-volume reporting, including generating reports for online viewing in the library and printing them for physical distribution. Although I know these aren’t currently supported, I’m interested in hearing from anyone who has developed workarounds or alternative approaches for their clients...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/looking-for-innovative-management-reporter-solutions/

item.title: GoDaddy has expanded its presence to 11 Asian markets
item.description:
GoDaddy, a global technology provider for small businesses, has expanded its reach into 11 Asian markets. This expansion brings GoDaddy’s cloud-based products and customer support services to millions of small and medium enterprises (SMEs) within the region. With these 11 new markets, GoDaddy now operates in 14 markets across Asia, encompassing 10 languages. These markets include Hong Kong (English and Traditional Chinese), Indonesia, Japan, Malaysia (English and Malay), Philippines (English and Filipino), Singapore (English and Simplified Chinese), South Korea, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/godaddy-has-expanded-its-presence-to-11-asian-markets/
